text: How are the studies going anyway, good?
Still feel free to ask me any questions you can think of about life after school / college / university and how the working world really is
When is your retakes? Perhaps we can plan a date after your retakes to start talking properly if that works?

I thought the below might be useful for you. I found a great list of companies that do ICT / software development internships and it seems like some only look at GCSEs and also some are fine with science related subjects at A-Level:

There are usually over a hundred Information & Communications Technology vacancy adverts across London listed at <http://www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch|www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch>, including many Intermediate and Advanced IT Apprenticeships. Other websites with Health, Public Service & Care Apprenticeships include:
:clubs:	British Army Communications & IT Apprenticeships, details <http://www.army.mod.uk/belong/apprentice/|www.army.mod.uk/belong/apprentice/> 
:clubs:	Cornerstone Cyber Security Higher Apprenticeships, £450 per week, GCSE grades C+/4+ in maths, English & science or ICT needed, closing 16/12/2017, details <http://www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch|www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch> (input Ref. number 1152378 in the Keyword box)
:clubs:	Google Software Development Higher Apprenticeships, A Level grades B+ or equivalent in science, technology or maths subjects needed, closing 19/1/2018, details <http://www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch|www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch> (input Ref. number 1319356 in the Keyword box)
:clubs:	Just IT have IT Apprenticeships and Advanced Apprenticeships at <http://www.justit.co.uk/apprenticeships|www.justit.co.uk/apprenticeships>
:clubs:	Microsoft Apprenticeships, details and links to Microsoft Partner training organisations at <https://goo.gl/XHKoPL> (the working link to QA is <http://apprenticeships.qa.com>) 
:clubs:	New Horizons have IT Apprenticeships and Advanced Apprenticeships at <http://www.nhlondon.com/apprenticeships|www.nhlondon.com/apprenticeships>
:clubs:	QA Training have IT Apprenticeships and Advanced Apprenticeships at <http://apprenticeships.qa.com/home>
:clubs:	RAF IT Advanced Apprenticeships, details <http://www.raf.mod.uk/recruitment|www.raf.mod.uk/recruitment>   
:clubs:	TalkTalk Software Development Higher Apprenticeships, £307 per week, A Level C+ in ICT subject or equivalent needed, closing 31/10/2017, details <http://www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch|www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch> (input Ref. number 1292524 in the Keyword box)
:clubs:	UCAS Career Finder Searchable database of mostly Higher and Degree Apprenticeships at <https://careerfinder.ucas.com/>
Vodaphone Network Engineering Higher Apprenticeships, 3 A Level grades C+ including an IT subject needed, closing 13/10/2017, details <http://www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch|www.findapprenticeship.service.gov.uk/apprenticeshipsearch> (input Ref. number 1307706 in the Keyword box)

attachments.text: Looking for your perfect career? Want to learn more about apprenticeships? Find out all there is to know about the latest career trend and join the QA crowd today!
